p: The moisture contents of raw TSF and WSF were 7.73 and 7.78%, respectively (Table 1), which were lower than the range of 8.83–8.76 obtained by Afify, El‐Beltagi, Abd El‐Salam, and Omran ( 2012) for sorghum flour. Fermentation decreased the moisture contents of both genotypes ( p ≤ 0.05). Incorporation of FBFPF starter at different levels (25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%) in the preparation of fermented sorghum flours had no significant effect on the moisture contents of the flour.
